summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020 forwarding a communication from a self-identified U.S. citizen crime victim to the Metropolitan Police Commissioner's office. The victim seeks to share information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell and requests a contact for interagency cooperation with U.S. authorities like the FBI and DHS. The emails show internal police coordination on how to handle the tip.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the potential victim's information and the Metropolitan Police Commissioner's stated investigative cooperation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Jeffrey Epstein as a subject of the potential victim's information.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Referenced by the complainant in relation to the Commissioner's disclosed intent to investigate criminal actions involving him, likely referring to Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Commissioner Dick
persons.context: The Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police Service, whom the complainant contacted after reading about her intent to cooperate with Epstein/Maxwell investigations.

persons.name: Mr. M.
persons.context: A Detective Inspector and Staff Officer to the Commissioner at New Scotland Yard who corresponded with the complainant, seeking clarification on her request.

connections.description: Both are named together as the subjects of the criminal information the complainant wishes to provide.
The complainant references the Commissioner's disclosed intent to investigate criminal actions involving Andrew.

events.title: Complainant's Report to HSI
events.description: The female complainant states she submitted a report to Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) on this date.

events.title: Initial Email to Commissioner
events.description: The complainant sends an initial email to Metropolitan Police Commissioner Dick, offering information and referencing her HSI report.

events.title: Police Response Seeking Clarification
events.description: A staff officer (Mr. M.) replies to the complainant's email, stating it is unclear what she requires and asking for reference numbers or directing her to standard crime reporting channels.

events.title: Complainant's Follow-up Clarifying Intent
events.description: The complainant clarifies she is a U.S. citizen crime victim seeking to share information and establish a contact for interagency cooperation between the Met Police and U.S. authorities (FBI, DHS) regarding Epstein, Maxwell, and Andrew.

locations: New Scotland Yard, Victoria Embankment, London, SW1A 2JL
keyFacts: A self-identified U.S. citizen and crime victim contacted the Metropolitan Police in August 2020 seeking to provide information on Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The complainant had previously filed a report with U.S. Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) on July 6, 2020.
The complainant's communication was motivated by reading that Commissioner Dick would be cooperating with investigations relating to Epstein and Maxwell.
The complainant specifically sought a departmental contact for interagency cooperation between the Met Police and U.S. authorities like the FBI and Department of Homeland Security.
The email chain shows internal police coordination on handling this potential tip, with the Met concurring that U.S. authorities should reach out to the complainant directly.
